channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NY

item.title: Report X-2024061088
item.description:
Report X-2024061088

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-20T15:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-18
  • City: SYRACUSE
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Found at door 107 load side. QA went over with proper PPE where the package was put in a hazmat bucket and bag. The package was then brought back to QA where it was found that all four bottles of hydrogen peroxide 35% had loose caps and leaked within the package.

item.title: Report X-2024061114
item.description:
Report X-2024061114

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-20T15:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-12
  • City: EAST SYRACUSE
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER DONNED PPE AND TOOK SPILL CART TO PINK BELT FOR HAZARD LEAKER. FOUND CORROSIVE BOX WITH WET SIDES AT TOP OF BELT. USED PH PAPER TO CHECK FOR ACIDITY AND DETERMINED LEAKER TO BE A BASE ACID. RESPONDER USED DECISION TREE AND CORROSIVE RESPONSE SHEET TO CHECK FOR HAZARD RESPONSE PROCEEDURES. USED ZEP ZORB AND LINED SPILL TRAY TO TRANSPORT BOX TO DAMAGE CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report X-2024060432
item.description:
Report X-2024060432

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-20T15:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-06
  • City: JAMAICA
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 6/5/2024 at approximately 1900, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 4009660 at the ramp facility in Jamacia NY, reporting an undeclared battery shipment. The shipment consisted of 4 cardboard containers wrapped in black shrinkwrap, each filled with used and damaged cell phones. None of the packages were properly declared as UN3481 Lithium ion batteries contained in equipment Section I. The shipment was not prepared in accourdance with IATA Regulation. The entire shipment was held pending an investigation by the FAA.

item.title: Report I-2024050082
item.description:
Report I-2024050082

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-20T15:13:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-03
  • City: KIRKWOOD
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: The New York Susquehanna and Western Railway
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 22000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: A FREIGHT TRAIN OPERATED BY THE NYSW RAILWAY, WAS TRAVELING EAST THROUGITHE TOWN OF KIRKWOOD, NY. A FARM TRACTOR ENTERED THE ROW AS IT DID NOT STOP AT A CROSSING. THE TRACTOR WAS STRUCK BY THE LEAD LOCOMOTIVE. WHEN THE TRACTOR WAS STRUCK, A PIECE FROM THE TRACTOR BROKE OFF, AND FLEW INTO THE SIDE OF THE FUEL TANK CAUSING A GASH. DISEL FUEL LEAKED FROM THE GASH. NYSW AND LOCAL EMS PERSONAL RESPONDED, AND PLACED MATERIALS IN THE GASH TO STOP THE FUEL FROM LEAKING. APPROX. DURATION OF THE LEAK, 10 MINUTES.

  • Description: CREATING REPLACEMENT REPORT FOR SPILL REPORT 9711. THE INFORMATION DID NOT SAVE CORRECTLY AND IT WAS ULTIMATLEY CLOSED WITHOUT CORRECTIONS. PACKAGE WAS LOCATED AT UNLOAD BY PH. MAANGER CALLED QA. PACKAGE WAS RECOVERED, INSPECTED, CONTAINED IN HAZMAT DRUM REPORTS FILED 06/05/24. ORIGINAL REPORT 9711 WAS SUBMITTED ON 06/05/24.

item.title: Report X-2024060932
item.description:
Report X-2024060932

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-18T15:12:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-23
  • City: ROCHESTER
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 5/22/2024 at approximately 1900, Dangerous Goods Adminstration received a call from Employee 5204557 at the ramp facility in Rochester, reporting a spilled undeclared postal package. The shipment appeared to consist of one fiberboard box. Based on the attached documentation, the commodity appears to be paint thinner, however, we are unable to confirm because the shipment is a postal package. Postal has taken possession of the shipment and the aiarcraft was been cleaned from the spill. Aircraft maintinance has cleared the aircraft for service.

NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 35E0Y1, LANDSMAN MEAT CO LLC, 1666 ROUTE 9W, MILTON NY 12547-5430.

item.title: Report E-2024060040
item.description:
Report E-2024060040

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-17T18:16:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-29
  • City: TONAWANDA
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 29, 2024, one (1) 55-pound bag of UN2680 was torn during loading and released approximately less than one (<1) pound of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Republic Services (RS) to remediate the impacted site. RS personnel utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the lithium hydroxide-impacted trailer. All waste was collected and containerized into one (1) 30-gallon poly drum and staged on site for transport and disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024060192
item.description:
Report E-2024060192

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-17T18:16:00+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-18
  • City: TONAWANDA
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: When loading a pallet of pails into a trailer the forklift operator stuck the forkblades into the pallet the pails were staged on and while doing so the forkblades were slightly tilted back causing one of the blades to go through the wooden slats of the pallet consequently slightly puncturing a pail contributing to the unintentional release. Spilled material was neutralized and cleaned with absorbent and placed into a recovery container as was the punctured pail.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XNW experienced a UN2222 Rhodiasolv MPE XP release from a 55-gallon metal drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 10-gallons of product released to an 8’ x 12’ area of the trailer floor due to a forklift puncture. The damaged drum was containerized into an 85-gallon poly overpack. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The impacted absorbents were then collected and containerized into a 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • City: BRONX

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While Unloading freight from trailer material handler discovered a box that was slightly leaking. Further investigation revealed that the box looks like it had been hit by a forkblade consequently puncturing the box contributing to the unintentional release. Spilled material was cleaned with absorbent and placed into a recovery container as was the damaged box.
